channel.title: Erdem's HmmBlog
channel.description: A blog about thoughts and games with data

item.title: Clustering Optical Water Types
item.dc:creator: Erdem Karakoylu
item.description:
This post describes an attempt at reproducing a study of ocean color optical water types (OWT). Here, remote sensing reflectance (Rrs) was used to classify regions of the ocean according to their apparent optical properties The author uses fuzzy c-means (FCM) clustering. However, K-means clustering yields results that are pretty close to FMC. So that's what I'll use here.

Read more… (19 min remaining to read)

item.title: Titanic Diaries - Part I: Data Dusting
item.dc:creator: Erdem Karakoylu
item.description:
My Goal:¶

In most data science tutorials I have seen, a lot of the data clean-up is done in what seems to me casually, an annoying obstacle to get to the sexy Machine Learning bit. I was curious to see what if any difference it made in my Kaggle ranking if I used a somewhat more cautious approach in my data cleanup. My approach was to dumbly follow Datacamp's tutorial and submit my test set labels as a benchmark. The second step is then to use a more elaborate data cleanup process and see whether taking the extra time actually moves my ranking up, or maybe down.

Read more… (12 min remaining to read)
